page.title: 09 THE PEOPLE OF FAVERSHAM
page.content: A cross-section of the people of the town were asked some questions about living in Faversham.About 75% liked it, the majority in the 40+ age group.This group were also the majority who thought that there was enough good entertainment in the town and it was a good shopping centre.All the other age groups disagreed,the highest was that outsiders would find the town's history interesting.Only just over half the people thought Faversham a tidy town.We also asked about where people worked. The interviewees were asked about the main income earner of their family. About a third of them work in Faversham & another 13% in Kent.Only 8% worked in LONDON & 3% elsewhere.A massive 43% had no main income earner through unemployment or retirement.Over half of the people asked had more than one income earner in the family.
